chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Y: Type
X: Type
T: relation2 X Y
R: relation2 X Y
S: relation2 X Y

Goal:
incl R S -> incl S T -> incl R T

Premises:
incl : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
relation2 = fun X Y : Type => X -> Y -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments relation2 (_ _)%type_scope
comp_incl : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R' : relation2 X Y) (S' : relation2 Y Z) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), incl R R' -> incl S S' -> incl (comp R S) (comp R' S')
union2_incl : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R1' R R1 : relation2 X Y), incl R R' -> incl R1 R1' -> incl (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1')
star_incl : forall (X : Type) (T' T : relation X), incl T T' -> incl (star T) (star T')
plus_incl : forall (X : Type) (T' T : relation X), incl T T' -> incl (plus T) (plus T')
ssrfun.tagged2' : forall w : {x : ?I & ?T_ x & ?U_ x}, ?U_ (ssrfun.tag2 w) where ?I : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- Type] ?T_ : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- ?I -> Type] ?U_ : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- ?I -> Type]
trans_incl : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R : relation2 X Y), incl R R' -> incl (trans R) (trans R')
eq_sigT2_rec : forall R0 : ?u = ?v ->...-> Type] ?u : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}] ?v : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}]
eq_sigT2_ind : forall R0 : ?u = ?v ->...-> Type] ?u : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}] ?v : [X : Type Y : Type S : relation2 X Y R : relation2 X Y T : relation2 X Y |- {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}]
eq_sigT2 : forall (u v : {a : ?A & ?P a & ?Q a}) (p : projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u) = projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v)), eq_rect (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v)) p = projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 v) -> eq_rect (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) (fun a : ?A => ?Q a) (projT3 u) (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 v)) p = projT3 v ->...-> Type]
union_incl : forall (I X Y : Type) (F' F : I -> relation2 X Y), (forall i : I, incl (F i) (F' i)) -> incl (union F) (union F')
comp_eeq : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R' : relation2 X Y) (S' : relation2 Y Z) (R : relation2 X Y) (S : relation2 Y Z), eeq R R' -> eeq S S' -> eeq (comp R S) (comp R' S')
incl_refl = fun (x : X) (y : Y) (H : R x y) => H : incl R R Expanded type for implicit arguments incl_refl : forall (x : X) (y : Y), R x y -> R x y Arguments incl_refl [x y]
ssrbool.in_mem = fun (T : Type) (x : T) (mp : ssrbool.mem_pred T) => ssrbool.pred_of_mem mp x : forall T : Type, T -> ssrbool.mem_pred T -> bool Arguments ssrbool.in_mem {T}%type_scope : simpl never
ssrbool.sub_mem = fun (T : Type) (mp1 mp2 : ssrbool.mem_pred T) => forall x : T, is_true (ssrbool.in_mem x mp1) -> is_true (ssrbool.in_mem x mp2) : forall T : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T -> ssrbool.mem_pred T -> Prop Arguments ssrbool.sub_mem {T}%type_scope
union2_eeq : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R1' R R1 : relation2 X Y), eeq R R' -> eeq R1 R1' -> eeq (union2 R R1) (union2 R' R1')
trans_eeq : forall (X Y : Type) (R' R : relation2 X Y), eeq R R' -> eeq (trans R) (trans R')
union2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
Variant mem_pred (T : Type) : Type := Mem : ssrbool.pred T -> ssrbool.mem_pred T Arguments ssrbool.mem_pred _%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.Mem [T]%type_scope
comp : forall X Y Z : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Z -> relation2 X Z
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
union : forall X Y I : Type, (I -> X -> Y -> Prop) -> relation2 X Y
trans : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y X
eta2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
star_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Ring_theory.pow_pos : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R
Field_theory.NPEequiv : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Prop
Ring_polynom.mkmult_rec : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> R -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_polynom.mkmult1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
